CWEs: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through an Error Message
CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
vulnerabilities: Sensitive information exposure through environment variables
Error messages may reveal sensitive information
description: The function is vulnerable as it exposes sensitive information through environment variables (SERVE_USER and SERVE_PASSWORD). It also does not have CSRF protections, making it susceptible to Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks. The function may also be vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks due to improper neutralization of input during web page generation. Additionally, error messages may reveal sensitive information which could be exploited by an attacker.
